office: Congressional Relations Office, Office of the Chief of Staff, Office of the Librarian

planning, coordinating and carrying out approved projects
informing the Director of progress as appropriate
requirements: Law degree or Graduate degree in Public Policy or related field desirable

key_responsibilities: coordinating and maintaining the Member’s schedule
front office duties
conducting Capitol tours
greeting office visitors

California ties and Spanish language proficiency strongly preferred

key_responsibilities: managing—and ensuring the smooth execution of—all aspects of the member’s daily and long-term schedule
providing related administrative support
requirements: committed to individual liberty, economic freedom, and the Constitution
ability to exercise sound, independent judgment

key_responsibilities: covering immigration and other issues
requirements: Proven writing and research skills required

key_responsibilities: managing constituent correspondence
supervising interns

greeting visitors
conducting research

ability to juggle multiple tasks with competing priorities

key_responsibilities: preparing and staffing the Member for committee hearings and floor votes
developing and advancing legislation and other policy priorities of the Member
representing the Member in meetings
drafting constituent correspondence
requirements: strong written and oral communication skills
Knowledge of the Affordable Care Act, Medicare, Medicaid, and the legislative process required

key_responsibilities: Establishing and maintaining relationships with national and D.C.-based media
Coordinating all media efforts and communications-related events
Drafting and distributing press releases and media advisories; drafting, editing, and placing op-eds
Pitching stories to reporters, responding to press inquiries, and serving as the point-of-contact for national press
Monitoring media narratives and identifying opportunities to promote the Member
Overseeing franked communications strategy
Managing the congressional website
Coordinating and staffing the Congressman for interviews and events
Compiling and distributing press clippings
requirements: superior written and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: tracking legislation and other developments to brief the Member on floor votes and pending legislative matters
developing and implementing policy initiatives in line with office goals
meeting with constituents and other interest groups
coordinating with DC and district staff regarding legislation, messaging, and events
requirements: ability to work effectively in a fast paced environment

key_responsibilities: drafting correspondence
making travel arrangements
developing and managing scheduling system, tracking requests and invitations
schedule maintenance and coordination with district scheduling requests
providing administrative and clerical support to Member and chief of staff
requirements: outstanding interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
acute professional and political judgment, and discretion at all times
minimum 1-2 years of prior scheduling experience on a campaign or in a Capitol Hill office
direct ties to the U.S. Virgin Islands or Caribbean strongly encouraged
Fluency in Spanish is a major plus
Strong work ethic, sense of humor and team players highly desired
